entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 6:16AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STORM FORCE LOW FOR MID WEEK... A strong low over the Gulf of Alaska looks to bring a storm force front to the panhandle for the middle of the week. entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 06 at 9:11AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .Downstream flow on the Saint Johns River near Astor remains hindered due to persistent northerly winds and tides. The river is forecast to decline into this weekend, while remaining in Minor Flood Stage.

entry.summary: ...Gusty winds expected Today... A strong low pressure system will move through the Great Lakes today. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 9:52AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ENHANCED FIRE DANGER TODAY... Minimum relative humidity levels are expected to drop to between 30 and 35 percent this afternoon, as southwest wind increases to between 10 and 15 mph. The combined effects of the increasing wind and low relative humidity levels will result in an enhanced fire danger today.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 9:33AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ENHANCED FIRE DANGER IN WEST VIRGINIA TODAY... Relative Humidity values will lower to between 28 to 35 percent through early this afternoon, before gradually recovering through early this evening. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 5:49AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow through tonight.. This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Periods of snow. Accumulations of 3 to 5 inches through tonight, with higher amounts possible above 9500 feet. * WHERE...Yellowstone Park and the Absaroka Mountains.
